Daniel Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Daniel 3

  • Daniel 10
  • Daniel 11
  • Daniel 12
1 And at that time shall Michael stand up, the great princess who standeth for the children of thy people; and there shall be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation even to that same time; and at that time thy people shall be delivered, every one that shall be found written in the book. 2 And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to reproaches and everlasting abhorrence.   3 And they that are wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament; and they that turn the many to righteousness as the stars for ever and ever.

 4 But thou, O Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, even to the time of the end; many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased.' 5 Then I Daniel looked, and, behold, there stood other two, the one on the bank of the river on this side, and the other on the bank of the river on that side. 6 And one said to the woman clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river: 'How long shall it be to the end of the wonders?'
7 And I heard the woman clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, when she lifted up her right hand and her left hand unto heaven, and swore by Her that liveth for ever that it shall be for a time, times, and a half; and when they have made an end of breaking in pieces the power of the holy people, all these things shall be finished. 8 And I heard, but I understood not; then said I: 'O my domina, what shall be the latter end of these things?'

 9 And she said: 'Go thy way, Daniel; for the words are shut up and sealed till the time of the end. 10 Many shall purify themselves, and make themselves white, and be refined; but the wicked shall do wickedly; and none of the wicked shall understand; but they that are wise shall understand. 11 And from the time that the continual burnt-offering shall be taken away, and the detestable thing that causes appalment set up, there shall be a thousand two hundred and ninety days. 12 Happy is she that waiteth, and cometh to the thousand three hundred and five and thirty days.
